text:
Since I am a medical student I would like to debate on the great invention of "first aid".I am not sure it is appropriate to talk about it as an invention, maybe it is more a wonderful initiative.
Everything started in 1870, during the violent Franco-Prussian war. Alex Dupont, a military surgeon, outraged by the increasing number of suffering and abandoned  victims, decided to open an informal hospital in a church in order to take their pain in charge.
He managed to get the citizens involved (those who were not as war so that it included mainly women and elderly persons).
His goal was not only to cure the wounds of the soldiers, but also to help them contacting their families, sending prayers to their close relation before passing by.
His initiative was based on a strong yearning for humanism and social progress.
This is how the Red Cross was born. It is still an active organisation nowadays. The activities it proposes are constantly improving. From a will to help the soldiers at war, it is now opening to the sailers in dangerous situations. Te Red Cross also provides goods and support for war victims, citizens in distress during battles.
The Red Cross is now more than a medical organisation. It is a human association which joined by anyone dreaming of helping his society to be more united.
 Now that you know more about the birth of first aid, it is time tu discuss the consequences of this great initiative.
First of all, the Red Cross is a real source of inspiration for anyone who to put some humanity in his life. It gives a real opportunity to discovering the harshness of life on some part of glob, and understanding how lucky we are ti live in Europe.
Then, it gives to soldiers some hope while their are at war, knowing that if something happen to them, their will be someone to try rescuing them or at least if things turn bad, that their family will be taken in charge.
First aid is now present in our everyday life. Today it is obvious that taking care of others is everyone's moral mission. In the street you can find automatic defibrillator to rescue a victim of a heart attack.
Anyone can follow some courses to learn the basis of first aid, like the cardiopulmonary resuscitation.
It is also possible to buy some first aid kits in case of daily accidents.
To conclude first aid is on one hand the traduction of a more human society vision, and on the other, it became a real advantage to fight against the risks life can put in our path.
